>
> =
Agreed, it is the best camera to get. There are several models available:
>=
 some have built in IR lights, some have IR / UV lights, some are set-up fo=
r
> sky watching, and others are just plain ol' full spectrum.
> 
> With th=
is camera (depending on the model, a regular one with the different
> optio=
ns run around $120-150), you will also need the power supply ($12-$20),
> a=
 tripod, and a portable recorder. My group uses 2 of them and each one is
>=
 attached to a portable DVD recorder that has a small LCD screen, you can
>=
 find these refurbished for under $100.
> 
> Tim
